comment: This class is absolutely superfluous if you're a second semester freshman. Do not make the mistake I did and take it in the spring. The lectures were condescending and drawn-out. Dr. Reese is a great guy! This course is the main issue, not him. However, he took ages to grade. And do NOT miss an assignment because it WILL hurt you.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: KSU had me sign up for this class and bragged about an easy three credits. I must have taken the wrong prof because there was so much work in this class. Work he took his time grading, tests with a book we never talked about, and a group project with an unclear motive. If you're taking this class, change your professor.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--So many papers

comment: As a KSU 1101 teacher, hes not the best. He started off cool, but he has a hard time giving us work and actually explaining it well. He almost never grades, despite all the work he assigns, and to be quite honest, this class wasnt even beneficial for me. As a biology professor, Im sure hes better. But I dont think this is the class for him.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: This is the WORST professor I've ever taken. He half lectures. And his quizzes are really exams. No multiple choice on exam . He says he wants short answers but he really want a whole dissertation.  He doesn't answer questions straight up. He is rude .
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Honestly, people complaining about Professor Reese need to grow up and realize this is college - not high school. He is INSANELY fair and gives you the grade you earn. No curves. No extra credit. If you answer the objectives THOROUGHLY, you will get an easy A. He designs lectures around the objectives, so go to class like an adult and get an A.
Grades are largely based on if you agree with him and how big your cup size is. Doesn't help if you are a guy.

This guy is unhelpful and completely mean.  Don't expect any miracles on if you study your tail off because you have to know how to put it into play on the test.  His tests are extremely hard and he'll pick 3-6 diagrams every test randomly.  Out of 60-90 diagram per 3 chapters, that is a lot of diagrams to know by heart.  He doesn't answer quest.

Very unhelpful professor. Many times I would raise my hand and he would completely ignore me and ask other students around me if they had any questions. He also counted me absent twice even though I never missed a lab. I tried to talk to him about it and he just said "Oh well". Those attendance points cost me my grade.

Professor Reese doesn't curve lab practicals. You get what you deserve with him. However, he is quite helpful and if you pay attention to what he says you need to know, that will help you a lot for practicals. He is also very helpful so ask a lot of questions during labs. Wish I had asked many questions before the midterm.Could've made better grade

Terrible professor.  He tries to be funny but it just comes across as rude. His tests don't match what he teaches in class. He basically tells you there's so much material that you'll have to learn it on your own. His teaching style is hard to follow too. I didn't learn anything except what I taught myself. Very unhelpful when you have a question.

He really knows physiology and you will learn A LOT! His tests are hard because they require you to apply what you've learned not just memorize it. He gets very detailed, but can answer any question. I learned more in this class than I am in the upper level human phys. Be prepared to work for your grade. Study and read your book. He is passable!

This is by far the worst professor I have taken in college.. He talks about his reputation of failing students in class.. I have been to his office a few times and he is not helpful at all.. He rushed me out, and told me my answer to the objectives were wrong, but didn't help me with an answer.. Take this class else where if you can not KSU..

I can say that the anatomy teachers at KSU are not human and have no soul, Including Reese. Everyone knows that the anatomy classes at KSU are hard, but when professors encourage their students to fail, I lose all respect for them. I hope that he quits knowing all he does is cause his students misery and has forgotten the true meaning of teaching.

Dr. Reese is an excellent scientist, a funny and engaging lecturer, and a very nice guy. If you are not a serious student or if you are in the early stages of your academic career, do yourself a favor and select a different class. However, if you are ready and you actually want to learn something, he is one of the finest professors at KSU.

By far the hardest, most time consuming class I have ever taken. Do not take this class unless you have nothing else to do with your life, including sleep. 73% of the class either dropped or failed. I can say that be will prepare you for med/vet school. Just be prepared.

He's pretty funny. Talks really fast so it's hard to take notes but read the chapters before lecture and you'll do fine and do ALL the objectives and study them thoroughly that's where he gets his test questions from. Very hard class because there is a lot to learn. I got a B and it's attainable but you have to study A LOT

Hardest class I have ever taken. Ever. This class made me hate biology all summer long. DO NOT take this class in the summer. There is just not enough time for all the material. My friend and I used to joke about how much he talks about sex, which was at least once  class. Ugh!

I had him for lab.  It's a tough class, 2 lab practicals (standard for all) and pre labs and post labs (helpful for studying) that don't count much but if you're on the edge of the A/B line (like I was) it's very helpful!  He's pretty funny, crude though, you'll get used to it. Very helpful...get on his good side though, don't act like an idiot!

He was not helpful, esp in lab. Attendance is mandatory and he gives a "password" randomly each class. if you miss when he says the password then you can not access the hmwk via vista, too bad, you lose points. He expects failure. I passed the class but he told us all we should expect C's if we do well. Will not take him for 2222.
HE IS A VERY HARD TEACHER...HE DOES NOT PROVIDE ANY NOTES HE JUST TALKS AND YOU NEED TO TAKE NOTES..HIS TESTS ARE HARD..I KINDA LIKE HIS SENSE OF HUMOR BUT HE DOES NOT MAKE THE CLASS ANY EASIER

He is super hard!!! He trys to act like he is helpful, but he is very general. His exams are crazy. He wants exactly what he wants and nothing else. If you do not have the exact wording that he wants you will not successful.

Dr. Reese is a tough guy but knows his stuff. At any time you can go to him and ask him questions. Yes, his class is difficult, but A & P is not an easy class. The lab only has two practicals so you need to do fairly good on them if you want a good grade. Study!

I know that he is a very hard professor and that he expects a lot from his students, but taking his class is a life-changing experience for me. If you like science, and you are interested in going into med or vet school, then take his class.

I love that Dr. Reese is willing to listen to his students and work with them. He is easy going, but serious about his teaching. If you take his class you will definately learn what you need to in order to make it into medical school.

nice guy, very hard. Don't take with class load of upper level classes, you will need to spend a lot of time on his class. He's pretty picky and i could never figure out how to do better, even with using his tips and other's hints on studying. The more i studied and the better i thought i did the worse i did. Lab is aweful, picky and a lot to learn

in retrospect, i must say that i've never learned so much in one class in my whole college career.  yes, it was VERY time consuming and yes, there was A LOT of material, but at least the stuff was undertandable! his tests weren't tricky and he was always there to help.  getting out of that class with a B made me feel like i could do ANYTHING!

1) Never take the course as a summer class.  2) No matter when you take the course be prepared to study every spare second you can find. Dr. Reese's test are insane... and as for the lab-god bless.  If you are going to take the class just be prepared to study and take it very seriously.

A bit of a prick. Thinks that he is funny, and on occasion, is. Don't let his jokes fool you. IT IS A CLASS THAT YOU HAVE TO STUDY FOR. What he goes over in class is not necessarily on the test. Lots of things in the book and study guide that he does not mention. He has pop questions thru class to make sure that you are in class.

He can be a smartass, sweats a lot, goes off on a lot of tangents, but he knows his stuff. His 100 plus questions tests are fair, but very hard. Class averaged between B and C on the tests. Just as long as you READ the chapters, as you're assigned and not two nights before the test, you should pass.
You have to work extra hard to pass his class...not that easy.

if you can get past the vulgarity of his jokes and the fact that he only wears sandals, you'll do ok. one trick is to do the study guides while he's lecturing. but here's something - on the first exam, nobody got an A out of 120 people. Work hard because this is not a concept class, here you actually see what you study on the test, which i love.
No Comments

As long as you finish the study guides and attend every single class...you'll do fine.  He teaches well and uses the in-class remote power points which helps keep you alert in class.  He's only hard because we hardly ever finish all the study guides.  How well you do in his class reflects upon on your initiative to learn the material...just like all of the other courses.

Mouth like a sailor. Seems enthusiastic about his subject. For some reason doesn't pass back tests or offer to let you see original scantrons. Not my best experience as far as teachers go but not the worst either.

He is okay, but test is too hard and does not curve.He thinks you have to dedicate all your life to this one class.I think if you don't do anything else you should be okay with passing his class,but if you have other classes,and other things to do,do not think about taking his class.
Good and very helpful.  Offers any help you ask for or if you just want to talk about stuff.  Tests very fairly and is good.

Don't take him please.If you are an A student and needs a couple of c's.He is your man.He expects atleast 20 hours of work for his lecture only.If you plan to take him make sure you are ot signed up for any other classes or you will be sorry with your grades for your other classes.Stay away from him
